title: Interesting!
review: Best way to take the tour of this small yet interesting museum is with the guidance of Mr.Hemant, the museum care taker. I was pleasantly surprised when in the middle of explaining various collectibles, he sang a Rajastani folk song which still rings in my memory. Over all an interesting experience.

title: A quirky museum with family heirlooms
review: What was lacking in display and objects - these wee all the family heirlooms gathered by the owner was made up for by the articulate and passionate talk delivered by the owners son. Came a way feeling I understood a little more about the place and the various cultures that lived around Jaisalmer

title: Basking in Cultural Extravaganza!!!!
review: We never intended to visit the Folklore museum since it was not on our “To Do List”.  It was by sheer luck that we ended up there. Founded by a national award winning  teacher N.K.Sharma,  the museum is a manifestation  of the rich Rajasthani culture and life-style.  Not too difficult to locate, the Folklore museum is situated on the right of the lane which leads to Gadisar lake. The museum houses specimens of various attires worn by different tribes and accessories used to adorn camels for special occasions, wood fossils of Akal, Henna designs and the significance of some of those designs and many more. Ideal place for people with a penchant for ethnology, not too hard on the wallet – entry fee Rs 10

title: Too much information to read
review: The museum depicts as of who founded the root of Rajasthan and what was the reason behind its inception

title: Averages museum and puppet show.
review: Collection in museum is good, staff of museum is little bit arrogent. Puppet show performance is of average level. They needs more practice for better show. Average show good for visitors who are first time experiencing puppet show. Ticket are higher side.

title: Nothing so special..
review: Folklore Museum is a small place located within gadisar lake area. It has a collection of some traditional things. But such things can be seen at the other museums too. So you don't need to go specially there. Can be easily avoided.

title: Small museum
review: This is a small museum located near the Gadisar lake. Though this museum is small, we can get to see a lot of information here.

title: Mr Sharma you rock
review: This is a testament to one mans determination to keep his precious heritage alive. Come and see his mine of information and support a saint.

title: Small but great collection
review: Folklore Museum was small but collection was great. There was entry fees. Good for one time visit. Open time was about 10 am.

title: Brief visit!
review: An overstuffed collection of trivia that was difficult to figure out even though the owner/curator showed us around.

title: Small but truly amazing
review: It is very close to Gadisagar Lake. Very walkable distance from there, hardly 100 meter. You can cover this museum in half an hour.

title: 10 rupees entry
review: This place made our trip to Jaisalmer. The son of the owner took us through each room and explained all the items to us and about the different cultures and history of India. He was a very funny man and made the story's so interesting and we had an hour of continual laughs with him. They do a puppet show at 7pm however we did not stay to see it. We nearly skipped this place due to a lack of time but are so glad we didn't.

title: This Museum Made our Day in Jaiselmer
review: The son of the owner guide us throw their Museum, he was so funny. And it was very interesting hearing about the changing of India. It was the best Guide we Ever had in India!! Thank you for showing us This!!!

title: small museum
review: Its around the Gadsisar lake area, Entry fee is 10 Indian rupees. Its very interesting to see all the historical stuff and know the stories behind it. Also has a puppet show.

title: Pleasent introduction to the history and culture of Jaisalmer
review: We popped in on our way back to town having visited Gadisar Lake.  The curator warmly welcomed us and introduced us to the exhibits.  The exhibits are well presented and the accompanying information is written in excellent English, covering a good number of interesting local topics from textile making, local geology, and local history.  Certainly worth having a wander round when in Jaisalmer, and easy to do along with visiting the lake.

title: near gadisar lake, better than gadisar lake!
review: i seen this museum because i was really disappointed by the dirty gadisar lake there. this museum came on way while returning back from gadisar lake.

title: Near Gadisar Lake
review: This museum is managed by Mr. N. K. Sharma, the same person who also manages Desert Cultural Center. Entry fees is just 10 Rs. Photography is free inside. You can also cover Gadisar Lake and Desert Cultural Center on the same day. There is also a place where you can have the best view of Jaisalmer Fort and sunset.

title: Excellent Learning Experience
review: Located near Gadisar Lake, the museum is an effort by a single man, Shri N K Sharma, a retired award wining teacher who took up the cause of preserving the local cultures like puppetry of Rajasthan. the museum has a wide collection of local attires/ clothes, various music instruments, models of historical monuments, a many pictures and photographs depicting the history of Rajasthan and medieval India to the Raj era. The museum patronizes the art forms of Rajasthan and teaches them to new people so that the same could be preserved.

title: Nice Collections of souvenirs and Artefacts
review: The Folklore Museum of Jaisalmer is situated on the bank of the Gadsisar lake and features a wide collection of Souvenirs and artefacts of bygone years.Tourists can watch a video in the museum which shows musicians playing royal instruments.

title: Authentic - Deserves Support
review: This is a small Museum just off the path (on RHS) into Gadi Sagar and is easily overlooked. Whilst dusty and a bit run down due to the lack of funding this Museum contains many interesting insights into the cultural heritage of Jaisalmer and Rajasthan. The collections of musical instruments, pictures, paintings and religious artifacts are fascinating if looked at closely. Ignore the fact the pictures are faded and instead look at the details. We found the more we looked the more we wanted to spend time appreciating this unique collection.

title: not much to see
review: Situated on banks og Gadisar lake. Has collection of textiles, utensils, musical instruments, old photographs etc. All these you can see at better places in Jaisalmer.

title: Unexpected experience in a hidden great museum
review: We were passing by, coming from the lake and Mr. Hemant suggested us a spot to watch the sunset, after the amazing view we were heading off and he invited us to see the museum. We were very happily surprised, he gave us a full tour, teaching us about Indian culture and history with great sense of humor. We loved the tour, it was a great experience! Definitely recommended (and it's super cheap)

title: A small but interesting museum
review: Another typical small Indian museum, lots of bits and pieces, various artefacts with decent explanations. A half hour visit.

title: Interesting!
review: Best way to take the tour of this small yet interesting museum is with the guidance of Mr.Hemant, the museum care taker. I was pleasantly surprised when in the middle of explaining various collectibles, he sang a Rajastani folk song which still rings in my memory. Over all an interesting experience.

title: Unique Museum
review: We visited this place on an organised tour. It's easily overlooked but so worth visiting. The owner is so funny and enthusiastic. He even performed a traditional Rajasthani  for us. We only stayed for a half hour but for such a cheap price it's an excellent place to stop after visiting the lake

title: A gem for 10rupees
review: The owner ran out and asked if I'd like to see his traditional desert museum as I was walking away from the lake, after he said it was only 10rupees I thought why not. I got a very detailed private tour which was lovely and learnt a lot about the culture, however I had to sit down a few times due to the crazy heat! Loved it

title: Avoid
review: Fee Rs 10..can be avoided. near gadisar lake. on the right side of the approach road from the main road. everything in old and authentic but the museum is crumbling... Like all in Jaisalmer fort this also soon will be turned into shops to cater to the lake tourists

title: Nothing so special..
review: Folklore Museum is a small place located within gadisar lake area. It has a collection of some traditional things. But such things can be seen at the other museums too. So you don't need to go specially there. Can be easily avoided.
